question: Favorite to win on Polymarket day after debate?
description:
Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are currently scheduled to debate on September 10, 9 PM ET in an event hosted by ABC News. 

This market will resolve to “Kamala” if Kamala Harris is the Polymarket favorite to win the election one day after the debate. This market will resolve to “Trump” if Donald Trump is the favorite to win.

The favorite to win one day after the debate will be determined by looking at the 4 hour time window 24 hours after the debate is scheduled to begin, between Sep 11, 9 PM ET and 1 AM ET. This market will resolve to whichever candidate is ahead more than the other during this period.

The resolution source will be a comparison between the charts for each candidate found at https://polymarket.com/event/presidential-election-winner-2024 when the “6H” option is selected and decimals are turned on (settings icon -> Decimals toggled on). If the debate is postponed or cancelled, the rules will apply to the date one day after the first debate is rescheduled to begin. If no debate occurs before the election, this market will resolve to 50-50.

The relevant data points will be those each minute during 9 PM ET to 1 AM ET (i.e. 9:00, 9:01 up to 12:59 AM ET) for each of the candidates. Each of these data points will be compared minute-by-minute, and this market will resolve to whichever candidate is ahead more than the other. For example if they are tied in 160 data points, Trump is ahead in 60 data points, and Harris is ahead in 20 data points, this market would resolve to "Trump."

question: Tim Pool subpoenaed in September?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Tim Pool (https://twitter.com/Timcast) is subpoenaed by any court or agency in the United States between September 4 and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the subpoena to qualify for a "Yes" resolution, knowledge of it must be made public within the timeframe of this market.

The primary resolution source for this market will be the relevant government agency or court, or Tim Pool and his official or legal representative(s), however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Trump lead in RCP on Sept 13?
description:
This is a market on the RCP Polling Average margin between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris as of September 13, 2024, 12:00 PM ET. The spread referenced in the first table on the "2024 General Election: Trump vs. Harris" page at https://www.realclearpolling.com/polls/president/general/2024/trump-vs-harris will be used to resolve this market.

This market will resolve to 'Yes' if the RCP Polling Average is Trump +0.1 or more percentage points. Otherwise, this market will resolve to 'No'.

description:

In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for September 7 at 7:30 PM ET:

If the Tennessee Volunteers win, the market will resolve to “Tennessee.”

If the NC State Wolfpack win, the market will resolve to “NC State.”

If the game is not completed by September 14, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the NCAA, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Trump tweet less than 10 times this week?
description:
If Donald Trump (@realDonaldTrump), posts less than 10 times on X between September 6, 2024, 12:00 PM ET and September 13, 2024, 12:00 PM ET this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, only main feed posts, quote posts and reposts posts will count.

Replies will NOT count towards the total - however, replies on the main feed such as https://x.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1345967072006828033 will be counted by the tracker.

Deleted posts will count as long as they remain available long enough to be captured by the tracker (~5 minutes).

The resolution source for this market is the ‘Post Counter’ figure for posts found at https://www.xtracker.io/. Individual posts can be viewed by clicking "Export Data". If the tracker does not update correctly in accordance with the rules, X itself may be used as a secondary resolution source.

question: Will Trump say "mosquito" at Wisconsin rally?
description:
Donald Trump has scheduled a rally to be held on September 7 in Mosinee, Wisconsin.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "mosquito" during their appearance at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "mosquito" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to a slender long-legged flying insect with aquatic larvae, the female of which is known to suck blood.

If this candidate does not appear at this event, or if the event is otherwise cancelled or delayed beyond September 7, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

question: Will Boeing Starliner successfully return to Earth?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft successfully completes its return to Earth by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

A successful return is defined as the spacecraft touching down on Earth while maintaining structural integrity during descent/reentry and landing, without any incidents resulting in significant damage.

If the Boeing’s Starliner is destroyed before the resolution date this market will resolve to "No". 

The resolution source will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Will Elon tweet 300-324 times?
description:
If Elon Musk (@elonmusk), posts between 300 (inclusive) and 324 (inclusive) times on X between September 6, 2024, 12:00 PM ET and September 13, 2024, 12:00 PM ET this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, only main feed posts, quote posts and reposts posts will count.

Replies will NOT count towards the total - however, replies on the main feed such as https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1786073478711353576 will be counted by the tracker.

Deleted posts will count as long as they remain available long enough to be captured by the tracker (~5 minutes).

The resolution source for this market is the ‘Post Counter’ figure for posts found at https://www.xtracker.io/. Individual posts can be viewed by clicking "Export Data". If the tracker does not update correctly in accordance with the rules, X itself may be used as a secondary resolution source

question: US Open Final: Sabalenka vs. Pegula
description:
Aryna Sabalenka and Jessica Pegula are scheduled to play each other in the Final of the US Open Women’s Singles Tournament on September 7, 2024 at 4:00 pm ET.

This market will resolve to “Sabalenka” if Aryna Sabalenka wins her match against Jessica Pegula in the Final of the US Open Women’s Singles Tournament.

This market will resolve to “Pegula” if Jessica Pegula wins her match against Aryna Sabalenka in the Final of the US Open Women’s Singles Tournament.

If the match ends in a tie, is canceled, or delayed beyond September 14, 2024, this market will resolve to 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US Open (ex: https://www.usopen.org/index.html) including live footage, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Kamala positive favorability by Sunday?
description:
This is a market will resolve to “Yes”, if Kamala Harris's favorable rating by FiveThirtyEight is higher than her unfavorable rating for any day between September 1 (inclusive) and September 8, 2024 (inclusive). Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

Harris's favorable rating must be higher than her unfavorable rating, ties will not qualify.

The favorability ratings for each day must be finalized before they are considered for this market (namely once the next data point is available, the previous one is finalized).

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's rating poll aggregator, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/favorability/kamala-harris/, specifically the favorability rating indicated by the purple "favorable" trend line for the resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates the favorability rating will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market may only resolve to "No" once the first data point after September 8, 2024 is published. If no such data point is available by September 15, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to 'No.'"

Please note the resolution source reports the rating value to only one decimal point (e.g. 42.8%, 33.9%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market.
